projects.title: Bridge2AI Voice
projects.summary: Bridge2AI is a major NIH initiative aimed at creating ethically sourced, AI-ready biomedical datasets to advance trustworthy and inclusive healthcare AI. The Voice project focuses on collecting and analyzing diverse speech data to develop voice-based biomarkers for health conditions. It involves collaboration among institutions including Stanford University, Cornell University, Johns Hopkins University, Yale University, University of Toronto, Simon Fraser University, Mount Sinai Hospital, etc. I contribute to this project by analyzing clinical voice data and developing deep learning models to predict neurodegenerative conditions from acoustic features.
highlights: Analyzed voice and speech recordings from patients with neurodegenerative diseases (e.g., Alzheimer's, Parkinson's).
Extracted acoustic features and trained deep learning models to detect clinical indicators from audio signals.
Collaborated with an interdisciplinary team contributing to one of NIH's flagship AI and health initiatives.
